alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 10:29AM EST until February 19 at 4:45PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Holmes and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1026 AM EST, At 1030 AM EST, the Ohio Department of Transportation and local law enforcement continue to report roads closed due to flooding in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell across this area on Thursday. - Flood waters are receding across the region this morning and road conditions are expected to improve later this afternoon. However, State Route 60 in Holmes County and State Route 302 in Wayne County remain closed due to flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wooster, Millersburg, Orrville, Berlin, Walnut Creek, Loudonville, Dalton, Shreve, Killbuck, Holmesville, Glenmont, Mount Eaton, Nashville, Winesburg, Farmerstown, Smithville, Apple Creek, Fredericksburg, Mount Hope and Charm. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
